data.title: In conversation with Summer Salon artists x Sinenkosi Msomi. Sit back and listen in as artist Sinenkosi Msomi shares about their...
data.meta_description:
37 likes, 0 comments - bagfactoryart on November 9, 2023: "In conversation with Summer Salon artists x Sinenkosi Msomi.    

Sit back and listen in as artist Sinenkosi Msomi shares about their artwork on sale for the Bag Factory Summer Salon Fundraiser.

Start building your art collection today!       

Sinenkosi Msomi, is a self-taught photographer based In Eswatini, exploring the tensions and relationships between cultural and traditional history and youth culture in Eswatini. ‘Untamed’ explores the themes of strength and resilience. 

The subject stands forward boldly and thus almost challenges the viewer, through this Msomi has allowed the subject to be the dominating figure in the photograph like being a leader trying to dominate in a hostile environment. Msomi explains that in this changing world it is often difficult to stand for one’s on values. Msomi shares that ‘Untamed’, “represents the few that refuse to flock with the masses”. 

His position as a young, Black African creative plays a major role in his process and is honoured at various points of his practice, from the subjects he chooses, to the settings and aesthetics of the photographs. Photography is a medium of expression that makes the unseen elements of his lived experience seen, giving him the opportunity to craft and capture complex narratives in one image. 

Artwork Details:

Sinenkosi Msomi
Untamed
2020
Photograph printed on Luster paper
Image size: 30 x 40 cm
R 3 450.00 (Incl. Vat)

Exhibition from:
28 October - 17 November 2023

Location:
Bag Factory Artists’ Studios.
10 Mahlathini St, Newtown, Johannesburg, 2001

Open Mon-Fri 9am – 5 pm or By Appointment
